name: The International Center for Law & Economics
legal: Non-profit under the laws of Oregon, USA
goal: ICLE promotes the use of Law & Economics methodologies to inform public policy debates. We believe that intellectually-rigorous, data-driven analysis will lead to efficient policy solutions, consumer satisfaction, and global economic growth.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Information Society, Research and Technology
euInitiatives:
Digital Single Market Strategy
Antitrust actions
Platform liability
Intellectual property
